head.title: World Briefing | Europe: Russia: Kyoyo Pact Passes Upper House

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: Russia: Kyoyo Pact Passes Upper House

abstract.p: Russia's upper house of Parliament votes overwhelmingly to ratify Kyoto Protocol, international treaty to limit emissions of gases linked to global climate change; Pres Vladimir V Putin is expected to sign measure (S)

block.p: Russia's upper house of Parliament, the Federation Council, voted overwhelmingly to ratify the Kyoto Protocol, moving the country closer to final approval of the first international treaty to limit emissions of gases linked to global climate change. The council voted 139 to 1 in favor of the treaty only five days after the lower house of Parliament approved it, putting it on a fast track for final approval by President Vladimir V. Putin. Once Mr. Putin signs, as expected, and the country submits its ratification documents to the United Nations, the treaty's requirements will take effect in 90 days, most likely by spring.

Russia's upper house of Parliament, the Federation Council, voted overwhelmingly to ratify the Kyoto Protocol, moving the country closer to final approval of the first international treaty to limit emissions of gases linked to global climate change. The council voted 139 to 1 in favor of the treaty only five days after the lower house of Parliament approved it, putting it on a fast track for final approval by President Vladimir V. Putin. Once Mr. Putin signs, as expected, and the country submits its ratification documents to the United Nations, the treaty's requirements will take effect in 90 days, most likely by spring.
